heading: Ch. 1 Process
text: Figure 1. CalCOFI data workflow.original raw data, often tabular format [e.g., comma-separated value (*.csv)], gets ingested database R scripts use functions lookup data tables R package calcofi4r functions organized Read, Analyze Visualize concepts. application programming interface (API) provides program-language-agnostic public interface rendering subsets data custom visualizations given set documented input parameters feeding interactive applications (Apps) using Shiny (web application framework) reports using Rmarkdown (report templating framework). Finally, R scripts publish metadata (Ecological Metadata Language) data packages (e.g., Darwin format) discovery variety data portals oriented around slicing tabular gridded data (ERDDAP), biogeographic analysis (OBIS), long-term archive (DataOne, NCEI) metadata discovery (InPort). database spatially enabled PostGIS summarizing data Areas Interest (AoIs), whether pre-defined (e.g., sanctuaries, MPAs, counties, etc.) arbitrary new areas.ERDDAP: great gridded tabular data, aggregate server clip specific area interest

heading: 4.1.1 Typography
text:
{*}: indicates variable substitution, e.g. {mdl_key}_mdls evaluate value am_mdls mdl_id = "" (AquaMaps)[*]: optional value, [ply_grp] optional column {mdl_key}_mdls table<*>: surrounds columns used uniquely identify (index) row...: additional columns, unique tableThe format following format top line bulleted list item describes table columns table directly , nested hierarchical order:{table name} ({description})
<{column 1}, {column 2}>, {column 3}, ...

heading: 4.1.2 Database Naming Conventions
text: Use lower-case column names underscores (.e. using janitor::clean_names()) prevent need quote SQL statements.short unique identifiers use suffix *_id integer *_key short text.

heading: 4.2 Spatial Tips and Conventions
text: Set PostGIS geometry fieldname geom.Use ST_Subdivide() running spatial joins large polygons.
